1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12
Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child
Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Blaine D. Ciardo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:48  Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court, in custody, via video.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson appears in court.    Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Calling 14cf91 and 18Cf361.
Amended Information filed.   State moves to Dismiss but read in 14CF91 and dismiss counts 1,2,3,5,7,8,9 in 18cf361.  Granted -

02:30 PM Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court, in custody with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson, both appearing by video. Mary M Sowinski, ADA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reporter appears by video. Calling 14CF91 & 18CF361. Court statement to remote appearances due to Supreme Court Order - COVID-19. Counsel notes counsel engaged in discussions off the record/outside presence of the court prior to hearing. Bonneson statement--an agreement has been reached with regards to both cases. Sowinski cites agreement-- in 14CF91, State would agree to dismiss the deferred count, but read in that count for purpose of victim to address the court and consider conduct as part of sentencing in 18CF361. In 18CF361, defendant would plead to Cts. 4, 6, and new Ct. 10. State to file amended Information. Counsel joint recommendation in Ct. 4 of 4 yrs. IC/5 yrs. ES; Ct. 6 and Ct. 10 - 3 yrs. probation but consecutive to Ct. 4. There has been no discussion regarding fines/costs - will be left to the court. Credit to be determined. Bonneson concurs with agreement as cited on the record. Court statement to credit; leaves JT on calendar for 9/14 at this time. Bond continued. Adj. 2:45 p.m.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2020 at 01:30 pm.

02:33 PM Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court via video, in custody,  with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson appearing via zoom video.     Mary M Sowinski appeared via zoom video for the State of Wisconsin.    Court statement to remote appearances due to Oneida County/Supreme Court Order - COVID-19.
Calling 18cf361 and 14cf91(DEJ status).
Court statement to status of case - Sowinski statement - has had discussions with Attorney Bonneson  - all discovery has been provided from previous counsel - both counsel request additional PTC to finalize. Bonneson statement - confirms.
Bails continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2020 at 02:00 pm.p

Bonneson statement to status of cases  request 18cf361 be set for trial. 3 days requested by State. 14CF91 will be set for status on trial date. 
Court statement regarding length of case/time limits - Bail continued  adj 11:18
  Jury trial scheduled for September 14, 2020 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2020 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo and ADA Mary M. Sowinski appearing by video

11:32 AM Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson, appearing telephonically. Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in custody, appearing by video means. Mary M. Sowinski appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 18CF361 & 14CF91. Court statement to remote appearances/YouTube due to Supreme Court Order - COVID-19. Court review of case. Bonneson states he was able to speak with Defendant. Defendant states he would like Bonneson to represent. Defendant agrees. Bonneson requests a status hearing. Court states Stay-at-Home Order should be lifted by next appearance - will not require in person appearance at next hearing. Sowinski statement to filing from defendant re: trial court. Requests order to remove from CCAP. Bonneson reviews - agrees to be sealed. Court orders to seal the Affidavit of Truth that was filed by Defendant on February 28, 2020. Bond continued. adj. 11:42 PM  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2020 at 11:00 am.

The original history event date is: 02-28-2020
Objection to Court Refusing to Post Ruling for Defendants Outstanding Motions onto Court Record

03:30 PM Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson, appearing telephonically. Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in custody, appearing by video means. Mary M Sowinski appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 18CF361 & 14CF91. Court review of case. Court states if Defendant wants to take a waiver of counsel would need to find competent. Defendant states he is objecting to being appointed an attorney at this time. Court states if he does not want to be appointed counsel he would need to waive right to counsel. Court advises Defendant either Attorney Bonneson will represent or waive right to counsel. Court in recess 03:37 PM.  Back on record 03:38 PM. Court questions Bonneson if Defendant gives up right to attorney, would he be on stand-by counsel. Bonneson believes he could be on stand-by. Bonneson suggests he meet with Defendant before waiver is taken. Defendant agrees. Bond continued. adj. 03:43 PM  Status conference scheduled for April 24, 2020 at 11:30 am.

10:34 AM Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court, in custody, appearing by video means. Mary M. Sowinski appeared (telephonically) for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 18CF361 & 14CF91. Court states there is an order in place for emergency purposes concerning the COVID - 19 virus - requiring the use of phone/video for appearances. Court review of case. Court/Sowinski statement to Defendant waiving counsel. Sowinski statement to items/testimony/issues at trial. Court states needs to find if Defendant is competent to defend himself. If he does represent self he would have to deal with issues. Defendant states he does not waive counsel. Court will wait appointment of counsel. Defendant statement to motions/affidavit filed. Court will not address until counsel is appointed. Court will determine if Court will need to appoint counsel if PD is not appointed before next appearance. Bond continued. adj. 10:47 PM  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2020 at 03:30 pm.

03:45 PM Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court, in custody, appearing by video means. Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 18CF361 & 14CF91. Court review of case - states PD has been unable to appoint. Defendant was informed case may be delayed. Court states Defendant has right to PD counsel - not allowed to pick counsel. Court states Defendant made decision to remove Attorney Mongin - finds any delay is because of his decision. Court statement to filings from Defendant - received response from DA's office. If Defendant is appointed counsel - next appearance may be at an earlier date. Defendant statement to his motions/affidavit filed - stands behind -requests a written ruling. Court states Defendant has not waived right to counsel - court not to rule until counsel is appointed. Defendant would like to waive counsel. Pfeifer statement to Sowinski's availability. Court set hearing to take waiver counsel - Sowinski can appear by phone. Bond continued. adj. 03:57 PM  Hearing scheduled for March 20, 2020 at 10:30

12:02 PM Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court with attorney Andrew P. Mongin.  Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in custody appearing by video means.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14CF91 & 18CF361. Sowinski has withdrawn all previous offers (child not to testify) and suggests a motion hearing on recinding DEJ. Court/Sowinski/Mongin statement to DEJ. Mongin statement to motion/timelimits. Sowinski states motion was filed timely and court had extended. Court statement to motion/new charges. States new charges would need the victim to testify. Counsel to see JA to schedule trial. Sowinski states 2 day trial. Mongin agrees. Pretrial to be scheduled if JT has not been scheduled by November 4, 2019. Mongin asks if he can appear by phone. Court direct to have scheduled by November 4th. adj. 12:14 PM  Need further action scheduled for November 4, 2019 at 08:00 am.

10:42 AM Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court with attorney Andrew P. Mongin. Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in custody. Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement to motion to reinstitute proceedings. Sowinski statement to probable cause - agreement has been violated. Mongin states Defendant disputes charges in new case and has not been convicted. Mongin statement to paragraph 4 in Deferred Prosecution Agreement. Court addresses Deferred Prosecution Agreement and explains meaning of language. States the State has complied with terms of filing motion. Court states probable cause was found at preliminary hearing. Court not granting motion at this time - has not been found by preponderance of evidence that a crime was commited yet. Court goes over options to State. State requests motion to recind be continued and see if parties can reach an agreement - addresses concern with times child needs to testify. Court addresses other cases - states DEJ has not expired and will leave motion pending is granted. Bond continued. adj. 10:57 AM  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2019 at 03:30 pm.

03:34 PM Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court with attorney Andrew P. Mongin. Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in custody. Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 18CF361 & 14CF91. Sowinski requests trial date and questions motion to resind in 14CF91. Sowinski states they have all discovery. Mongin agrees. Bond continued. Motion hearing set for 14CF91. 18CF361 set for trial. Counsel to meet in Chambers at 8:15 before trial. Mongin statement to motions. Court states will take care of at pre-trial. adj. 03:44 PM  Court trial scheduled for October 14, 2019 at 08:30 am. Motion hearing scheduled for August 21, 2019 at 10:30 am. Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2019 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
10:11 am - Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler.  Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files Amended Information.  Kessler in receipt of Amended Information.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1 and guilty to counts 2 and 3.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of counts 2 and 3 but defers judgment on count 1 and accepts the DPA.  Schiek/Parents of victimKessler/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing. 
Court Sentence - Counts 2 & 3 - Concurrent
WHS/POP 5 years
Court Costs/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Jail 12 months - 114 days jail credit -W/Huber for all purposes
No unsupervised contact with any minor children other than own child
No access to computers or electronic devices with internet ability
DNA testing/sample
Register as Sex Offender
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights, NADVI given

04:18 pm - Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court, in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Calling 14cf91 and 14cf102.  Voorhees appears for today's purposes - Court questions Atty Voorhees as to appointment of new counsel.  Oder appointing counsel from PD's office is in file - Shelia Kessler.   has been appointed.  Court will adjourn to allow for contact between newly appointed attorney and defendant.  Bail continued.  JA to send notice to Atty Kessler.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

03:04 pm - Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Calling 14cf91 and 14cf102.  Voorhees - Requests withdrawal due to conflict - PD's office has appointed new counsel.  Court will adjourn.    Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

4:03 p.m. Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court, in custody, with attorney John E Voorhees. Steven M Michlig, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense moves to sequester witnesses. Court grants motion. State calls Joshua Chiamulera, Detetective Sergeant with RPD, sworn, direct. Witness identifies defendant. Cross by Voorhees. 4:17 p.m. recess. 4:18 back on record, all parties present. Redirect by Michlig/Recross by Voorhees. Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial. Bond continued. Arraignment scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 03:30 p.m.

10:33 am - Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in custody.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Calling 14cf91 (PH) and 14cf102 (AIA).   In 14cf91 - Schiek states witness is unavailable - Schiek willing to proceed on report as allowed by hearsay rule.  Voorhees objects to proceeding without witness.  Court statement to hearsay rule.  Voorhees objects to a continuance.  Voorhees motion to modify bond in 14cf102.  Schiek statement to bond modification - opposes any modification to bond.  Court requests additional information prior to modifying contact w/defendant and there be more involvement with the relevant local agencies.  Court grants continuance for preliminary hearing and sets both cases for preliminary hearing.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 03:45 pm.

02:12 pm - Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in custody.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files Amended Criminal Complaint.  Voorhees in receipt, waives reading.  Voorhees requests a continuance of the preliminary hearing due to the filing of the amended complaint and the new complaint filed in case 14cf102.  Prelim time limits waived.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 10:30 am.

02:36 pm - Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in court, via video, with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Blaine D. Ciardo in custody.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing.  Voorhees/Schiek statement to motion to modify bond.  Court denies motion.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
